WorkItem.ClosedComment: Fixed in SVN (= resolution of Work item 6347 - PHPExcel handles empty cells other than Excel)
WorkItem.Description:
This issue is related to my previous issue,
IF(A1="","empty";"not empty") returns "not empty" in Excel if A1 contains the number 0. Because in PHP 0 == ""
WorkItem.Summary: PHPExcel handles 0 and "" as being the same

Comments.Message:
And again, posting my issue went wrong. The 'Create new item'-form handles hitting Enter as a form submit (even in the description field)!

Anyway I think the problem is clear. It's the difference in type handling between Excel and PHP. I think it's a hard one to fix!
